data.enText: a large or special meal, especially for a lot of people and to celebrate sth
a day or period of time when there is a religious festival

data.chText: 使人欢快的事物（或活动）
data.enText: a thing or an event that brings great pleasure

data.chText: 这个晚会真是让音乐爱好者大饱耳福。
data.enText: The evening was a real feast for music lovers.
to eat a large amount of food, with great enjoyment

data.chText: 尽情欣赏；大饱眼福；赏心悦目
data.enText: to look at sb/sth and get great pleasure

means: 使人欢快的事物(或活动)

ex.chText: 为什么我们正餐不吃鱼呢？
ex.enText: Why don't we have fish for dinner?

ex.chText: 她已被邀请出席该公司的年度晚宴。
ex.enText: She has been invited to the company's annual dinner.

synonyms.bx: 指中午或晚上吃的正餐，也常指为庆祝某事而举行的正式晚宴。

ex.chText: 为来访学者举办的宴会
ex.enText: a banquet in honour of the visiting scholars

ex.chText: 总统在国宴上发表了演说。
ex.enText: The president made a speech at the state banquet.

synonyms.bx: 通常有多人参加、为某一特殊时刻而举行的正式宴会。

ex.chText: 很多名流出席了她的婚宴。
ex.enText: There were many celebrities at her wedding feast.

ex.chText: 布朗先生受到邀请出席国王举办的盛大宴会。
ex.enText: Mr. Brown was invited to the feast held by the King.

synonyms.bx: 指宴席或酒席，没有 banquet 正式，强调出席宴会之人共享欢乐的气氛。

ex.chText: 春节期间全家人都会聚在一起。
ex.enText: The whole family will get together at Spring Festival.

ex.chText: 很多游客和当地居民一起欢庆一年一度的丰收节。
ex.enText: Many tourists have joined the local residents' celebrations of the annual harvest festival.

synonyms.bx: 指一年中庆祝某一特殊事件的某一天或一段时期，常指宗教节日。

ex.chText: 他的生日庆贺活动吸引了很多电影明星前来参加。
ex.enText: His birthday celebrations drew many movie stars.
There will be a display of fireworks at the celebration.

synonyms.bx: 指为庆祝某一特殊事件而举行的活动。

ex.chText: 圣诞节是基督徒最重要的节日吗？
ex.enText: Is Christmas the most important feast for Christians?

ex.chText: 国王为他尊贵的客人们举行了盛大的宴会。
ex.enText: The king held a feast for his distinguished guests.

synonyms.bx: 指宗教节日，也指为庆祝而设的盛宴。

data.chText: 尽情欣赏；大饱眼福；赏心悦目
data.enText: to look at sb/sth and get great pleasure

tr: a meal that is well prepared and greatly enjoyed
example: a banquet for the graduating seniors
they put out quite a spread

tr: a ceremonial dinner party for many people

example: feed one's eyes on a gorgeous view

tr: partake in a feast or banquet
provide a feast or banquet for

value.def: A feast is a large and special meal.

example.ex: Lunch was a feast of meat and vegetables, cheese, yoghurt and fruit, with unlimited wine...
example.tran: 午餐很丰盛，有肉、蔬菜、奶酪、酸奶、水果, 酒无限量供应。

example.ex: The fruit was often served at wedding feasts...
example.tran: 婚宴上经常有水果供应。

example.ex: On the following day a feast was given in King John's honour.
example.tran: 第二天设宴款待约翰王。

value.def: If you feast on a particular food, you eat a large amount of it with great enjoyment.

example.ex: They feasted well into the afternoon on mutton and corn stew...
example.tran: 他们吃玉米炖羊肉一直吃到下午。

example.ex: Starving dogs feasted on the human corpses.
example.tran: 饿狗贪婪地啃食着人的尸体。

value.tran: 饱餐;尽情地吃;大快朵颐

value.def: If you feast, you take part in a feast.

example.ex: Only a few feet away, their captors feasted in the castle's banqueting hall.
example.tran: 仅在几英尺外，捉拿他们的人正在城堡的宴会厅里大吃大喝。

example.ex: The feasting, drinking, dancing and revelry continued for several days.
example.tran: 一连几天都是宴会、痛饮、舞蹈和狂欢。

value.def: You can refer to a large number of good, interesting, or enjoyable things as a feast of things.

example.ex: This new series promises a feast of special effects and set designs...
example.tran: 这部新的系列剧将会是一场特效和舞美的盛宴。

example.ex: Chicago provides a feast for the ears of any music lover.
example.tran: 《芝加哥》将给所有音乐爱好者献上一场听觉的盛宴。

value.tran: 大量(赏心悦目的事情);盛宴

value.def: A feast is a day or time of the year when a special religious celebration takes place.

example.ex: The Jewish feast of Passover began last night...
example.tran: 犹太人的宗教节日逾越节昨晚开始了。

example.ex: At Christmas the visitors began their circuit of dropping in on the eve of the feast day.
example.tran: 圣诞节时，客人们在节日前夜开始逐家拜节。

value.tran: 宗教节日;宗教节庆时间

value.def: If you feast your eyes on something, you look at it for a long time with great attention because you find it very attractive.

example.ex: She stood feasting her eyes on the view.
example.tran: 她驻足凝神欣赏这片景色。

trans: 因年而异的宗教节日(日期每年都可有变化)
